items.prompt: When approaching a blind corner, you should:

options.label: Speed up to get through quickly
Sound horn, slow down, and look carefully

items.explain: Horn, slow speed, and visual confirmation prevent collisions.

items.prompt: If you see a spill on the floor:

options.label: Stop, tag the area, and report/contain the spill

items.explain: Spills create slip hazards and must be properly contained and reported.

items.prompt: When pedestrians are in your work area:

options.label: They should stay alert and move out of your way
You must yield right-of-way and maintain safe clearance
Sound the horn continuously until they move

items.explain: Forklift operators must always yield to pedestrians and maintain safe distances.

options.label: Lowering the load and being mindful of mast height
Raising the load to clear the obstacle
Driving faster to minimize exposure time

items.explain: Lower the load and watch both load and mast clearance.

items.prompt: If the forklift data plate is illegible:

options.label: Continue operating if you know the specifications
Do not operate; tag out and request service
Estimate the capacity based on similar models

items.explain: Illegible data plates make capacity verification impossible; equipment must be serviced.
